card.title: How to open a company in Dubai: Step-by-step instructions
card.subtitle: Starting a business in Dubai is easy. We tell you where to start, what documents you need and how long the registration process takes.

FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.subtitle: Answers to the most popular questions about registering a business in the UAE.

items.q: How long does it take to open a business in the UAE?
items.a: The process typically takes 3–7 business days, depending on the business activity and approvals required.

items.q: Do I need a local sponsor to start a business?
items.a: In most cases, no. Free zone companies and many mainland structures allow 100% foreign ownership.

items.q: What types of business licenses are available in Dubai?
items.a: Commercial, professional, and industrial licenses — depending on the type of activity.

items.q: What are the main steps to starting a company in Dubai?
items.a: Choosing a jurisdiction, company registration, licensing, and opening a bank account.

items.q: How much does it cost to start a business in Dubai?
items.a: The cost depends on the zone and type of activity, starting from $5,000.

items.q: Can foreigners own 100% of their business in Dubai?
items.a: Yes, in free economic zones and in some cases on the mainland.
